title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. II, Forms (cf. Part 110), form B-1 - Application and order to extend examination period
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. II, Forms (cf. Part 110), form B-1 - Application and order to extend examination period

State Regulations
FORM B-1
APPLICATION AND ORDER TO
EXTEND EXAMINATION PERIOD
STATE OF NEW YORK
SUPREME COURT COUNTY COURT
PART: ________ COUNTY: ____________
________
PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK
vs. Indictment No. ____________
________
Defendant
________
(1)

The undersigned is authorized by
the State Commissioner of Mental Health to submit this application for and on
behalf of the said Commissioner to the court pursuant to subdivision 4 of C PL
330.20 for an order extending the period to complete the psychiatric
examination of the above-named defendant which is being conducted on an
outpatient basis pursuant to an examination order previously issued by this
court. (2)

This
court issued an examination order on [date] ________ directing that the
above-named defendant submit to a psychiatric examination to determine whether
the said defendant has a dangerous mental disorder, or if he she does not have
a dangerous mental disorder, whether the said defendant is mentally
ill. (3)

The
examination order referred to in paragraph (2) of this application directed
that the psychiatric examination be conducted on an outpatient basis at such
time and place as the Commissioner of Mental Health shall designate, and that
the said examination shall be completed by ________ (within 30 days) after the
defendant has first reported to the place designated by the

Commissioner. (4)

Pursuant to the examination order referred to in paragraph (2) of this
application, the following facility was designated by the Commissioner of

Mental Health as the place for conducting the psychiatric examination: ____________
____________. (5)

The above-named defendant
first reported to the place referred to in paragraph (4) of this application on
[date] ________. (6)

The psychiatric examiners designated by the Commissioner of Mental Health
pursuant to the examination order referred to in paragraph (2) of this
application have commenced their examination of the above-named defendant. The
30-day period referred to in the said examination order expires on [date]
________. (7)

The
undersigned is of the view that the psychiatric examination of the above-named
defendant will not be completed prior to the expiration of the period referred
to in paragraph (6) of this application, and that a longer period will be
necessary to complete the aforesaid examination for the following reasons: ____________
____________
and will be completed on the following date: ________. (8)

Written notice of this application
has been given to the above-named defendant, counsel for the defendant, the

Mental Health Information Service and the District Attorney. This written
notice was given at least five days prior to the date that this application
will be submitted to the court. (9)

No previous application for the
relief sought herein has been made. WHEREFORE, the undersigned respectfully
requests that this application be granted and that the court issue an order
pursuant to subdivision 4 of C PL 330.20 extending the time for completing the
psychiatric examination directed by the previously issued examination order, for an additional period not exceeding ________ days. ______________
Signature
______________
Type or Print Name
______________
Title

Date: ________
NOTICE OF APPLICATION
To: 1. Above-named defendant
2. Counsel for above-named
defendant
3. Mental

Health Information Service
4. District Attorney of ________
County
PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that the above
application will be submitted to the court on: [Date] ________
[Time] ________
ORDER
________
PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK
vs. ________
Defendant
________
Present: Honorable ____________
Justice of the Supreme Court

Judge of the County Court

This court having issued an examination
order on [date] ________ directing that the above-named defendant submit to a
psychiatric examination to determine whether the said defendant has a dangerous
mental disorder, of if he she does not have a dangerous mental disorder, whether the said defendant is mentally ill, And, the aforesaid examination order
directing that the psychiatric examination be conducted on an outpatient basis
at such time and place as the Commissioner of Mental Health shall designate, and that the said examination be completed within 30 days after the defendant
has first reported to the place designated by the Commissioner, And, the above-named defendant having first
reported to the said place designated by the Commissioner on [date]
________, And, the psychiatric examiners designated by
the Commissioner of Mental Health pursuant to the aforesaid examination order
having commenced their examination of the above-named defendant, And, the 30-day period referred to in the
aforesaid examination order expiring on [date] ________, And, an application having been made by the

Commissioner of Mental Health for an order extending the period to complete the
psychiatric examination of the above-named defendant for an additional period
not exceeding ________ days, And, due deliberation thereon having been
had, And, the court having found that a longer
period is necessary to complete the psychiatric examination ordered by this
court, It is hereby
ORDERED, that the Commissioner of Mental

Health is directed to complete the psychiatric examination of the above-named
defendant by [date] ________. Dated: ________
____________
Justice of the Supreme Court

Judge of the County Court

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. II, Forms (cf. Part 110), form
B-1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
